alert.note: Alert for Howell; Oregon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:36AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Howell and Oregon. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 836 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Piney Creek at County Road 228, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Middle Fork Eleven Point River at County Road 1420, Howell Creek at County Road 9790 and Bennetts River at Highway 142. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Thayer, Alton, South Fork, Koshkonong, Brandsville, Thomasville and Rover. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
